item.title: Multiverse Computing raises $215M for tech that could radically slim AI costs
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Spanish startup Multiverse Computing announced that it raised an enormous Series B round on the strength of a technology it calls “CompactifAI.”

item.title: Twenty years strong: a love letter to TechCrunch
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Here’s to the perspective that twenty years gives you, and to twenty more years of asking hard questions, helping readers see around corners, and working with people who make even the roughest days worth it.

item.title: Apple is salvaging Image Playground with a boost from ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: With the new ChatGPT integration, users will be able to access more styles that move beyond the emoji-like creations that Image Playground has become known for.

item.title: Europe, we’re not leaving. Period.
item.dc:creator: Michael Reinstein
item.description: There are some headlines making the rounds claiming that TechCrunch is “pulling out of Europe” and shuttering its coverage of European startups. This is flat-out wrong. It misrepresents who we are, what we do, and — most of all — what we believe. The recent changes at TechCrunch are not about retreat. They are about […]

item.title: Sam Altman-backed Coco Robotics raises $80M
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Coco Robotics has made more than 500,000 deliveries with its zero-emissions robots since they hit the streets in 2020.

item.title: All of the new features coming to Apple’s iOS apps
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: New features launching with iOS 26 include significant updates like Call Screening, more travel-friendly features in Wallet, and highly requested group chat features in Messages.

item.title: Fervo Energy lands $206M in financing to build massive geothermal power plant
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Fervo is developing what promises to be the largest enhanced geothermal power plant in the world.

item.title: Can Scale AI and Alexandr Wang reignite Meta’s AI efforts?
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Meta has reportedly invested billions of dollars into AI startup Scale AI and hired its CEO, Alexandr Wang, to lead a new AI research lab. So what does that mean for Meta and the rest of the AI ecosystem?

item.title: US government’s vaccine website defaced with AI-generated content
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.category: Department of Health and Human Services
item.description: The content of a vaccines information website owned by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services was swapped with gay-themed spam.

item.title: At WWDC, Apple says it will use AI to tag apps to improve discoverability on the App Store
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple will begin using AI technology to power the discovery of apps on the App Store, the company announced at this week’s Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC 25). In a session focused on updates to App Store Connect, its app distribution platform for developers, the company announced it will introduce App Store Tags — labels that […]

item.title: TikTok’s biggest star was detained by ICE, with help from another influencer
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The situation grabbed headlines after a teenage influencer, Bo Loudon, boasted on X that he flagged Khaby Lame’s immigration status to authorities.

item.title: Wikipedia pauses AI-generated summaries pilot after editors protest
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Editors almost immediately criticized the pilot, raising concerns that it could damage Wikipedia's credibility.

item.title: How to delete your 23andMe data
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: 23andMe holds millions of customers' genetic information. Here's what you can do to protect your data.

item.title: Snapchat rolls out a new $8.99 Lens+ subscription tier
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Snapchat is launching a new Snapchat+ tier called "Lens+," the company announced on Wednesday, which is centered around giving users access to exclusive Lenses and AR experiences.

item.title: Disney and Universal sue Midjourney, alleging AI-related copyright infringement
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: The studios are seeking monetary damages, a jury trial, and an order barring Midjourney from further copyright infringement.

item.title: Whole Foods warns of shortages after cyberattack at its primary distributor UNFI
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The retail giant described the food shortages as "temporary supply challenges" following the cyberattack at its primary distributor, UNFI.

item.title: Meta AI gains video editing capabilities
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Meta said Wednesday that it is adding video editing capabilities to Meta AI that let users edit short videos using preset AI prompts to change costumes, locations, and styles.

item.title: ChatGPT will avoid being shut down in some life-threatening scenarios, former OpenAI researcher claims
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Former OpenAI research leader Steven Adler published a new independent study that claims that, in certain scenarios, OpenAI's AI models will go to great lengths to try to avoid being shut down.

item.title: Jewel Burks Solomon’s Collab Capital has closed a new $75M fund
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The announcement of Collab Capital’s Fund II comes as Black-led and founded funds continue closing sizable funds.

item.title: AirPods Pro 3 could be on the way
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Apple might be releasing the AirPods Pro 3 sooner than you think.
